title: 第一章 不要燒我！
content:
Zhou Ze cupped a handful of water and splashed it on his face. He slowly raised his head, looking at himself in the mirror, looking a bit haggard. As an emergency room doctor, this haggardness seemed to be a standard feature.

"Doctor Zhou, a new patient is coming soon. It seems like they fell from a building, not sure if it was suicide!" Nurse Wang Ya called out from the men's restroom doorway.

"Got it, coming right away." Zhou Ze responded, then pulled out a tissue to wipe the water drops dry and started to walk out.

The ambulance quickly drove into the hospital. On the stretcher lay an elder dressed in a grey Tang suit. The elder was coughing incessantly, occasionally coughing up blood clots and fragments of splenic organs, and his entire body was covered in blood.

Zhou Ze immediately ran over, pushing the stretcher while observing the injured person's condition, and at the same time shouted to the people in front, "Prepare surgical instruments, quickly!"

The injured person's condition was very bad.

"I... I... don't want to die."

The elder opened his eyes, looking at Zhou Ze, who was closest to him.

"Don't worry, you'll be fine. We'll help you, you won't die."

Most critically ill patients say these words at such a time. Only a few can truly face death calmly. As doctors, this is not the time to analyze the patient's condition and tell them their chances of survival. What the injured person needs at this moment is psychological comfort.

"No... no... down there... down there... it's really too terrifying down there..."

The elder suddenly grabbed Zhou Ze's wrist, looking at him with a serious expression.

"Steady your emotions, relax, your life will be fine." Although his wrist was aching, Zhou Ze did not try to break free.

"I don't want... don't want to go down again... they... they found me... I... they found me..."

"Hiss..." Zhou Ze suddenly felt a sharp pain in his wrist.

"Doctor Zhou, your hand!" The young nurse beside him immediately cried out.

The elder's fingernails were long, and for some unknown reason, they were black, a translucent black similar to amber, not looking like dirt accumulated within them;

And at this moment, the elder's fingernails had already dug into the flesh of Zhou Ze's wrist.

"I'm not going down... not going down... not going down... haha... cough cough cough..."

The elder suddenly straightened up and coughed violently, then his body trembled, the hand that was gripping Zhou Ze's released, and he lost all movement.

"Prepare for resuscitation!" Zhou Ze shouted.

The elder was wheeled into the emergency room. Doctors and nurses began resuscitation measures, and the defibrillator was also ready.

"Doctor Zhou, let me take care of your wound." Wang Ya walked over at this moment.

As doctors, they are not really worried about such minor skin injuries. What they are most concerned about is if the elder has other diseases, which could put the doctor in a dangerous situation of occupational exposure. After all, there was a lot of blood on the elder's hand, and no one knew if he had any infectious diseases.

Some diseases, once contracted, could ruin a lifetime.

After the wound was bandaged, another doctor walked out of the emergency room and shook his head at Zhou Ze.

This meant that the person could not be saved.

Everyone's emotions were a bit down, but for them, such things were common, and they would adjust quickly.

"Doctor Zhou, let's do a check-up." Wang Ya suggested.

"No, I have something else tonight." Zhou Ze shook his head, walked directly to the changing room to change his clothes, then went to the hospital parking lot, got into his car, and left.

As soon as the car drove under the elevated section of Jianghai Avenue, Zhou Ze's phone rang.

"Hello, this is Zhou Ze."

"Doctor Zhou, the children are all waiting for you."

"I'm sorry, Principal Wu, a patient delayed me. I'm on my way now, please ask the children to wait a little longer for me."

"Okay, okay." The other side quickly hung up the phone.

Zhou Ze checked the time again, it was already 8:30 PM. The children at the orphanage usually went to bed early.

The red light turned green, Zhou Ze stepped on the accelerator and drove forward.

"Beep!!!!!!!!!!!"

Just then,

A heavy truck ran a red light and drove towards him. Zhou Ze only had time to turn his head and look out the car window at the blinding high beams,

Immediately,

"Bang!"

The world spun,

The small car, like a fragile piece of white paper, was directly hit and sent flying by the heavy truck. After tumbling several times in the air, it crashed to the ground.

...

"Ugh..."

Zhou Ze woke up,

He found his body completely unable to move, as if stuck.

At the same time, his eyes couldn't open. He knew he had been in a car accident, a very serious one. Out of professional ethics, he wanted to check his injuries immediately, but he couldn't move.

Around him, he occasionally heard the sound of other vehicles passing by, and various horn sounds.

Am I still at the accident scene?

Am I still in the car?

Zhou Ze thought to himself.

Soon,

The siren of a police car sounded, and then the sound of a fire truck,

Finally, the familiar siren of an ambulance arrived, which Zhou Ze found comforting.

Zhou Ze sensed his body being moved. The temperature nearby was a bit high, indicating that his car was being cut to rescue him.

Zhou Ze had participated in many such rescue operations and was familiar with some of the procedures.

What a pity, the cake in his trunk and the Children's Day party for the orphanage children would have to be canceled.

"Doctor Zhou!"

A familiar voice called out.

It must be Doctor Chen from the hospital.

Zhou Ze let out a long sigh of relief in his heart. At least, he had saved his life. This could be considered an unexpected disaster.

There were also a few nurses' voices nearby, but because of the surrounding noise, Zhou Ze couldn't hear them clearly.

But then, Doctor Chen's next sentence plunged Zhou Ze's heart into the abyss!

"Doctor Zhou has lost vital signs."

No,

I'm not dead!

I'm not dead yet!

I'm not dead!!

Zhou Ze screamed desperately in his heart!

He wasn't dead, he was still conscious, he wasn't dead!

Next, Zhou Ze felt someone performing CPR on him. He felt each heavy compression, but he couldn't open his eyes or speak.

He wasn't dead,

He hoped they would quickly realize he wasn't dead!

But after a flurry of activity,

Zhou Ze heard the crying voices of several nurses he knew,

Doctor Chen punched the nearby car door, looking very distressed.

Hey!

Don't give up!

Don't give up!

I'm not dead!

I should be in a state of suspended animation right now,

Excessive blood loss?

Severe injury?

But I'm really not dead!

I should still be breathing, I should still have a heartbeat!

Zhou Ze roared madly in his heart.

But next, he sensed himself being lifted onto a stretcher and then carried into an ambulance.

Then came the sound of the ambulance driving.

The nurses in the ambulance were still crying.

But their crying sounded exceptionally harsh in Zhou Ze's ears,

He wasn't dead,

Why cry!

Why are you crying!

Look at me again,

Look at me again,

Check again,

I'm not dead!

The ambulance stopped,

Immediately after, Zhou Ze heard the hospital leaders speaking:

"Xiao Zhou just... gone?"

"The car accident was very severe. Doctor Zhou was severely injured and lost too much blood. He has been confirmed dead."

"Really? He's just gone?" Another vice president still couldn't believe it.

"Xiao Zhou is gone." This was the voice of a department head. "I just checked again."

I'm not dead!

You quacks!

I'm not dead!

You bastards!

Bastards!

Zhou Ze cursed incessantly in his heart. At this moment, the people around him were no longer his colleagues, nor his friends, nor his leaders and elders,

They actually determined that he was dead,

But can a dead person still hear and perceive?

I'm not dead!

You bastards,

Animals,

Sons of bitches!!!!!

I'm not dead!

Save me!

Save me!

The stretcher began to move, the surroundings were quiet, and the temperature was gradually dropping.

"Xiao Ya, don't be too sad. The director said the hospital will hold a memorial service for Doctor Zhou tomorrow."

"Sister Suqin, I just can't believe it, a person, just gone like that. Doctor Zhou was such a good person, how could he just be gone?"

"The weather is unpredictable, and people have unforeseen misfortunes. Just try to accept it."

After saying this, the two nurses left.

Around,

Empty,

That chilling coldness,

Was so clear.

Zhou Ze kept struggling, trying to resist, he wanted to wake up, he desperately longed to make a sound.

But his current feeling was like sleep paralysis; no matter how much he tried, his body was completely out of his control.

Finally,

He gave up in despair,

He was tired,

And exhausted,

He knew where he was now,

In the hospital,

Mortuary.

...

When Zhou Ze "woke up" again, he felt a faint coolness on his face, and the stinging sensation was also very clear.

"Is the makeup done?" Someone asked from the side.

"Don't rush, wait a moment. He was hit and injured so badly, how could the makeup be done so quickly?"

"The hospital is rushing us, they need to send him to the memorial service soon."

"Or you can do it."

The mortician seemed a bit annoyed, applying makeup with more force. Of course, their clients were dead people, and dead people naturally wouldn't feel pain, nor would they worry about complaints. They just needed to show results to the living.

Zhou Ze no longer had the strength to struggle,

He just lay there quietly,

Enduring the stinging sensation of the makeup brush repeatedly pressing on his face,

Finally,

The makeup was finished.

"Alright, tell them to come in. We're done with our work."

Zhou Ze felt himself being changed into clothes, and then he was pushed out. Hospital orderlies carried him into a soft, cramped space.

This,

Must be a coffin.

Then, all the surrounding noise was instantly isolated,

The lid must have been closed.

Shaking,

Wobbling,

Bumping...

After an unknown period, Zhou Ze finally heard sounds again. The coffin lid must have been opened.

What entered his ears,

Was funeral music.

The hospital director was speaking into a microphone, praising him, lamenting him,

Then the vice director and the head of department, and so on.

Around,

He occasionally heard footsteps passing by,

Some people just quietly walked past, taking a last look at him,

Some tried to call his name a few times, with a crying tone,

This was the viewing of the remains.

Viewing,

My remains!

I'm not dead,

I'm really not dead,

I'm not dead yet!

Not dead!

Zhou Ze wailed in his heart,

He started trying to struggle again,

But still couldn't,

He could only hear and feel,

But couldn't speak,

And couldn't open his eyes,

Everyone thought he was dead,

But he knew,

He wasn't dead yet!

The children from the orphanage also came, crying by his side.

They cried sincerely, because Zhou Ze himself was a child who grew up in an orphanage, and because of this, after starting work, most of his salary was donated to the orphanage. The car accident happened because he was rushing back to the orphanage that night to celebrate Children's Day with the children.

"Xiao Zhou, rest in peace. This time, you died in the line of duty. You have no family, but your compensation will go to the orphanage, don't worry." The vice president said, standing beside Zhou Ze.

Subsequently,

Zhou Ze sensed himself being isolated again; the coffin lid must have been closed once more.

Then another bout of bumping,

Finally, it stopped.

The coffin lid was opened again,

Around, it was a bit quiet, occasionally hearing human voices, but not noisy.

Two people, one holding his shoulders and one holding his legs, lifted him up and placed him on another cold rack, which seemed to be made of steel.

These two people were very skilled, extremely skilled.

Around him, there were faint sounds of crying.

Zhou Ze initially couldn't distinguish where he had arrived,

But at this moment,

He suddenly understood,

Bastards!

They brought him to the crematorium!

They were going to burn him!

I'm not dead, you bastards!

Damn your ancestors!

I'm not dead!

Not dead yet!

Don't cremate me,

Don't cremate me!

I'm really not dead yet!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

You beasts,

Misfits!

Sons of bitches!!!!!!!!!!!!

This time, it was Zhou Ze's most frantic and maddest attempt.

He knew,

Once he was cremated,

There would be no turning back!

He would face death directly!

A complete and utter end!

He was unwilling, he was truly unwilling. He was not yet thirty, he hadn't started a family, he didn't have children, he still had a life, he still had a long way to go!

"Mom, I just saw this uncle's hand move." A little girl's timid voice sounded beside him.

"Slap!" A small slap across the mouth.

"Don't talk nonsense, I'll deal with you when we get home." The girl's mother scolded.

Zhou Ze despaired,

Because no matter how much he struggled,

How much he roared in his heart,

The people outside could not perceive it.

He was placed on the conveyor belt,

The machine started,

He was being pushed forward,

He knew what he was about to face,

And because of this, he was incredibly afraid!

No,

No,

No!

I'm not dead, I'm really not dead!

Don't burn me!

Don't burn me!

No one could hear his cries,

They were only responsible for feeling sad,

Only responsible for being upset,

Only responsible for completing this process,

Then going home for dinner, and continuing on tomorrow.

Finally,

Zhou Ze sensed himself being pushed into a narrow place full of the smell of oil residue,

Immediately after,

A sticky liquid sprayed onto his body,

He knew what it was,

It was gasoline,

Immediately after,

"Sizzle..."

Hot!

Very hot!

Pain,

Intense burning pain!

Fire,

Fire,

Big fire,

Fire everywhere...
